caption: By far the best shawarma in all of Brooklyn. This place reminds me a lot of the shawarma in Ramallah.

This was honestly the best shawerma I’ve had since I came to America. Reminded me of back home. Not to mention how hospitable and attentive the staff and owner was. Thankful I found this spot, will definitely be coming back when I’m in the area.

Honestly one of the best authentic shawarma spots I’ve had the pleasure of enjoying with my girls! We’re all big on middle eastern dishes and it’s authenticity and this one hit the most like home. You gotta try it out; amazing service, and everybody was so absolutely sweet.
This is the best shawarma in the area! It taste exactly like the shawarma back home, the service was amazing. I’ll drive 3hrs every weekend for this place!
The food is good, the baked breads are fantastic. But they can be a bit slow.

Very delicious chicken shawarma, I recommend you splurge for the premium version which is an amazing and very filling sandwich.  The guys are honest and hard working, the food is tasty, and it's reasonably priced!

The bread is good but almost everything else is terrible. I had to toss my order in the garbage as it was really unedible: Kibbeh super oily, its like eating a sponge soaked in burnt oil. The shawarma chicken low quality, really bad. The bakery part is good, I can recommend buying bread from here.

My family and I came here to have lunch/dinner. The food was unbelievably delicious. I highly recommend the chicken shamwra sandwich. The owners were super friendly and joking with the whole time. This place is awesome. Phenomenal falafel's and I usually just say "make it they way you'd make it for yourself" cause there's so many options. The falafel is big enough to eat half for dinner and the other half the next day. And, the staff is just so incredibly friendly they make you feel so at home going in to order. Highly recommend this little restaurant!

Everyone at the party loved the food couldn’t stop commenting on how authentic and great the food tasted! I would deff  recommend their food and will cater from their for our kids birthdays and special events!

One of the best places to eat in Brooklyn The guys there are so welcoming and helpful If you don’t have money they won’t charge you The food is fresh and halal You can order special stuff out of the menu and they will make it for you The food is so yummy And specially fresh !
Amazing falafel and hummus. Also has 1 of the best chicken sharwarma around. Very clean.
The best food in town! If you don't eat here you're missing out!

The best 🍞 and cockefd food on New York

The shawarma here...you won’t believe it! I didn’t want to stop eating. It is unlike any shawarma I have ever had before. A little upset since I thought the shawarma here in Philly was good, but now nothing will compare to this. The bread was so soft and the flavor of the meat and whatever else they put in there was amazing. In sh Allah I’ll be back next time I visit NYC. If you guys wanna open a shop in philly I’ll be your first customer!!  *update* I’m sorry to say I have to update my review after my most recent trip here over the weekend. The man who works at the counter and makes the food was very rude to me. Perhaps because I don’t speak Arabic. He didn’t even so much as crack a smile or even attempt to be polite or appreciative. The icing on the cake was, he slammed my money on the counter and didn’t even say thank you or goodbye. And on top of that, the shawarma was not nearly as good as the first time I had it. It was overly salty this time and not enough garlic sauce. I would be able to overlook the food being a little lacking and just call it a one-off, but the character and rudeness of the employee just put me off this place. If they want to succeed they will need to treat their customers with respect. I don’t see any business sense in a restaurant which doesn’t value their customers.
Love it soooo much, amaizng food and super friendly staff
As authentic as it gets.  Best Palestinian style bread, falafel and hummus anywhere in Brooklyn.  Very friendly service.  Zaatar pie is delicious and fresh in the morning.  Can't say enough.

Place is incredible! Their shawarma, falafel, breads and cookies, and dips (hummus, mtabbel, msbahha) are all delicious. Be sure to check out their daily specials, my favorite is musakhan on Tuesdays.
The best, lightest, fluffiest hummus I have ever had. Other MUST haves: chicken laffa and falafel appetizer.

I am regular customer but i am disappointed by you guys, for the first months when they opened it was ok but after a lot of changes in the customer service they smiled in your face but fake smile specifically the guy who prepare the bread very very bad experience with him,  second thing there prices, when I give them order depending on the person who work on my order every person give you deferent price on the same order I bought a small plate no rice no meat just  small pieces of vegetables and some gravy he charged me $ 10 and this happens to me more than 3 times with the same guy the worst that the food he give to me I can't finished, It will be the last time buying food from your

Very authentic and delicious food!!! I had lamb shish and my husband got shawerma, he said it was the best shawerma! I tried their hummus, so far is my favorite from all that I've tried before. The guys are very nice and friendly,  give us some falafel samples which were delicious!!! All I am saying is ,if you are in the are definitely give it a try!👍👍👍they also bake all the bread and pitas there fresh daily
Chicken and beef shawarma sandwhiches are the best in NY! Backed full of juicy meat and spices coated on the bread. Not one bite was without flavor.

PALESTINE 🇵🇸 Eat the World NYC review: If you come in seeking only takeout orders, as many do, please do not miss the opportunity to walk towards the back and check out the baking go on. Baskets full of different types of breads, pre-packaged containers of cookies, and all kinds of pastries sold by weight are all made here by the skilled bakers, as are stacks of breads available for purchase. A gigantic oven sits at the back, and if you are too shy to peek around the corner just ask to use the restroom and you will have to walk by. The oven fills the restaurant with intense heat, and the man rolling and tossing dough for flatbread sheets called laffa (or taboon) looks just like a pizzaiolo.  "This bread is straight from Jerusalem!" was stated at least five times about the delicious ka'ak during our stay and it could be felt how significant this was to him. Even in Palestine the bread is unique to the city, travelers from other parts buy many loaves to bring as gifts to their friends and family. The crust is soft and covered in sesame seeds, the bread inside even softer and so light. Despite being almost a meter long before cutting, it is not heavy and feels like it might float away.
The food was amazing the the ka3ak the made is the best. The service was so good
